meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: adoption application (領養申請) means an application for a Convention adoption order;
adoption certificate (領養證書) means a Convention adoption certificate;
adoption order (領養令) means a Convention adoption order;
Court (法院) means the Court of First Instance;
guardian ad litem (訴訟監護人) means a guardian ad litem of an infant for the purposes of the adoption application that relates to the infant.

subsection.content: Expressions used in these Rules that are defined in Part 5 of the Ordinance shall have the respective meanings assigned to them in that Part.
A reference to a form described by a combination of an alphabet and a number shall, unless otherwise stated, be construed as a reference to a form so described and set out in Schedule 1.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.content: These Rules apply only to and in relation to Convention adoption.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Notice of intention
section.content: A notice of intention to apply for an adoption order shall be given in Form C1.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Proceedings to be disposed of in private
section.content: All proceedings under the Ordinance relating to Convention adoption are to be disposed of in private.

subsection.content: An adoption application shall be made to the Court by originating summons in Form C2.
The proposed adopter shall be the applicant, and the infant shall be the respondent.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the originating summons shall be served on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guardian ad litem and the Director (if he is not the guardian ad litem); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where rule 11(3) applies, the Director.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Identity of applicant may be kept confidential

subsection.content: If the proposed adopter desires that his identity shall be kept confidential, he may apply to the Court for a serial number to be assigned to him for the purposes of the adoption application and that number shall be assigned to him accordingly.
An application under subrule (1) shall be made before the proposed adopter issues an originating summons in Form C2.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Previous applications
section.leadIn: If it appears that the applicant has previously made an application to any court in Hong Kong for the adoption of the same infant (the previous application), the adoption application may not proceed unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the judge is satisfied that there has been a material change in the circumstances since the previous application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the previous application is made in respect of an adoption that is not a Convention adoption and has been withdrawn or disposed of.

subsection.leadIn: The evidence in support of an adoption application shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given by means of a statement by the applicant in Form C3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: verified by affidavit.

subsection.content: Any document signifying the consent of any person to the making of the adoption order shall be exhibited to the affidavit.

subsection.leadIn: Where the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the State of origin, the consent—

paragraph.name: a
b

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a guardian of the infant; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is liable to contribute to the maintenance of the infant by virtue of any order or agreement,

paragraph.continued: shall be in Form C4; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if given by a spouse of the applicant and—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the spouse is not a parent of the infant, shall be in Form C4.

subsection.content: Where the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the receiving State, any document signifying the consent of the spouse of the applicant shall be in Form C4.
The statement referred to in rule 9(1) shall be filed within 28 days after the issue of the originating summons in Form C2.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the applicant’s statement shall be served, at the same time when it is so filed, on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guardian ad litem; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director (if he is not the guardian ad litem).

main.crossHeading: Appointment and Duties of Guardian Ad Litem

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the State of origin; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director has become the guardian ad litem of the infant by virtue of section 5(5F) of the Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the Director shall be the guardian ad litem.

subsection.content: Where subrule (1) is not applicable, subject to subrule (3), the accredited body in Hong Kong that makes arrangements for the adoption of the infant by the applicant shall be the guardian ad litem. (10 of 2008 s. 46)

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant desires that the Director should be appointed to act as the guardian ad litem, then, the originating summons in Form C2—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must ask for such appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be supported by an affidavit by the applicant setting out the grounds for asking for such appointment.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant shall, subject to subrule (5), pay to the Director a fee of $4,440 in payment of the proper costs of the Director for acting as the guardian ad litem— (L.N. 57 of 2015; L.N. 144 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where subrule (1) applies) on the service of Form C2 on the Director under rule 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where subrule (3) applies) on the Director being appointed by the Court to act as the guardian ad litem.

subsection.content: The Director may, if he considers it necessary or desirable, waive payment of the fee or any part of it.

The Court may at any time, where it considers it to be in the interests of the infant, appoint the Official Solicitor to be the guardian ad litem of the infant in place of the Director or the accredited body (as the case may be).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Guardian ad litem to investigate all relevant circumstances

subsection.leadIn: The guardian ad litem shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: investigate as fully as possible all circumstances relevant to the proposed adoption with a view to safeguarding the interests of the infant before the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a report to the Court for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subrule (1), the guardian ad litem shall—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all matters alleged in the applicant’s statement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the additional matters specified in Schedule 2,

paragraph.continued: and shall report to the Court on them; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: interview (either by himself or by an agent appointed by him for the purpose)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: every applicant;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: every individual mentioned in the applicant’s statement in Form C3 as a person to whom reference may be made;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: every person on whom notice of the adoption application is required to be served under rule 19; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: (where such notice is required to be served on a body of persons) the appropriate officer of such body.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Information to be confidential
section.leadIn: The guardian ad litem and any agent of his and, where a body of persons is appointed as guardian ad litem, every officer, employee and member of that body—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall treat as confidential all information obtained in the course of the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not divulge any of the information to any other person except so far as may be necessary for the proper execution of his duty.

main.crossHeading: Applications under Section 5(5D) of the Ordinance

subsection.content: Where the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the State of origin, an application by a parent under section 5(5D) of the Ordinance for an order revoking that parent’s consent (revocation application) shall be made to the Court.

subsection.leadIn: The revocation application shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where an adoption application is pending, by summons in the adoption proceedings concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where paragraph (a) is not applicable, in accordance with rule 14A of the Adoption Rules (Cap. 290 sub. leg. A).

subsection.content: The Registrar of the High Court shall, after giving such directions (if any) as he thinks necessary, fix a date for the hearing of the revocation application.

subsection.leadIn: When the date for the hearing has been fixed, the Registrar of the High Court shall serve a copy of the summons on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proposed adopter in the adoption proceedings concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the guardian ad litem; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every other person on whom notice has been or will in due course be served under rule 19.

subsection.leadIn: If a serial number has been assigned to the proposed adopter in the adoption proceedings concerned, then in the revocation application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the summons to be served under subrule (4) shall not disclose the identity of that proposed adopter to any other person who is not already aware of that proposed adopter’s identity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings on the revocation application shall be conducted with a view to securing that that proposed adopter is not seen by or made known to any other person concerned with the application who is not already aware of his identity, except with his consent.

subsection.content: Where the revocation application is determined, the Registrar of the High Court shall serve notice of the effect of the determination and any order on the applicant of the revocation application and on all the persons served under subrule (4).

main.crossHeading: Applications under Section 6(4) of the Ordinance

subsection.content: Where the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the State of origin, an application under section 6(4) of the Ordinance for leave to remove the infant from the care and possession of the applicant shall be made to the judge.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of the application shall be served on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guardian ad litem; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director (if he is not the guardian ad litem).

section.name: s16
section.heading: Dismissal of application for adoption order

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the State of origin; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: leave to remove the infant from the care and possession of the applicant is granted under section 6(4) of the Ordinance,

section.continued: the judge may, on granting leave, dismiss the adoption application.

main.crossHeading: Applications under Section 23B of the Ordinance

section.name: s17
section.heading: Application for an order passing care and control of infant

subsection.content: An application for an order under section 23B(1) of the Ordinance for passing the care and control of an infant to a person authorized by the Director may be made to the Court by the Director by an ex parte originating summons.
The application shall be heard by a judge.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be supported by an affidavit by the Director that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sets out information on the infant’s identity, adoptability, background, social environment, family history and medical history;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sets out details of the person authorized by the Director for the purposes of section 23B(1) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sets out the grounds for the Director’s belief that the granting of the order will be in the best interests of the infant; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: states that the infant is or will be authorized to enter and reside permanently in the Contracting State to which the infant is intended to be sent.

subsection.leadIn: The following documents shall be exhibited to the affidavit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the infant’s birth certificate or any other proof of identity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order by which the Director was appointed as the legal guardian of the infant (if applicable);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consent of every person whose consent is required by section 5(5)(a) of the Ordinance (if applicable);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: order declaring that the infant is freed for adoption under section 5A of the Ordinance (if applicable);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: copy of the infant study report;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: statement of acceptance for adoption signed by the prospective adopter;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: copy of the family study and assessment report of the prospective adopter; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: letter of assumption of responsibility signed by the person referred to in subrule (3)(b) stating that such person is responsible for the welfare of the infant while the infant is in the Contracting State referred to in subrule (3)(d) and before the infant is adopted.

subsection.content: The applicant for an adoption order shall obtain an appointment for the hearing of the adoption application within 14 days after being notified by the guardian ad litem that he has made his report to the Court.
If no appointment is obtained by the applicant, the guardian ad litem shall obtain an appointment as soon as practicable for the hearing of the adoption application.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrules (2) and (3), on a date being fixed for the hearing of the adoption application, the guardian ad litem shall serve a notice in Form C6 on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the State of origin) every person whose consent to the making of the adoption order is required under section 5(5) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the receiving State) the spouse of the applicant whose consent to the making of the adoption order is required under section 5(5)(b) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director (if he is not the guardian ad litem).

subsection.leadIn: Where the Court is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person whose consent to the making of the adoption order is required by section 5(5)(a) or (b) (as the case may be) of the Ordinance cannot be found; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all reasonable steps have been taken to trace that person,

subsection.continued: the Court may, if it thinks fit, dispense with service of the notice under this rule on that person.

subsection.content: Where the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the State of origin, then, subject to subrule (4), it is not necessary to serve the notice on the parent of an infant who has given consent to an adoption order by way of general consent in Form 4A in Schedule 1 to the Adoption Rules (Cap. 290 sub. leg. A).
Subrule (3) shall not apply if the hearing of the adoption application is to take place within 3 months from the day on which the form was executed.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Appearance to show cause why order should not be made

subsection.content: On the hearing of the adoption application, any person on whom notice is required to be served under rule 19 may appear before the judge to show cause why an adoption order should not be made.
The Director may be represented by a public officer duly authorized in that behalf by the Director.

Unless the Court is satisfied that the applicant does not desire his identity to be kept confidential, the proceedings shall be conducted with a view to securing that he is not seen by or made known to any other person whose consent to the order is required, other than the spouse of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: Where the proposed adoption is one in respect of which Hong Kong acts as the State of origin, the Court may, if satisfied that there are special circumstances, direct that it is not necessary for either or both of the following persons to attend the hearing of the adoption application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the infant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant.

subsection.content: Except as provided for in subrule (2), the Court shall not issue an adoption order unless the applicant and the infant attend the hearing in person.
The Court may direct any person who is not a party to the application to attend the hearing of the application.

main.crossHeading: Forms and Transmission of Orders and Certificates

subsection.content: Unless the Court otherwise orders, an adoption order shall be drawn up in Form C7.
The Court shall, on the issuance of an adoption order, issue an adoption certificate in Form C8.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Copy of order and certificate to be sent to various parties

subsection.leadIn: In this rule and rule 24—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an adoption order includes an order for the amendment of an adoption order referred to in rule 27(1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an adoption certificate includes an adoption certificate that is amended under rule 27(3).

subsection.leadIn: On the making of an adoption order, the Registrar of the High Court shall, within 7 days after the order has been passed and entered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: send a sealed copy of the order to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of Births and Deaths;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applicant;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the guardian ad litem; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Director (if he is not the guardian ad litem); and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the applicant the adoption certificate issued in respect of the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to the Director a copy of the certificate.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Copy of order and certificate to be given to certain persons only

subsection.content: Subject to subrule (2), no duplicate or copy of an adoption order or of an adoption certificate shall be given to or served on any person except by order of the judge.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may give a copy of the certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the Central Authority of a Contracting State;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the accredited body in Hong Kong that makes arrangements for the adoption to which the adoption order relates; and

paragraph.name: c

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the accredited body of a Contracting State; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the public authority of a Contracting State,

paragraph.continued: that makes arrangements for the adoption to which the adoption order relates.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Notification by guardian ad litem of making or refusal of order

subsection.content: If a party was not present when an adoption order was made or refused, the guardian ad litem shall notify the party that the order was made or refused (as the case may be).
In complying with subrule (1), the guardian ad litem shall not disclose the identity of the applicant unless the applicant does not desire his identity to be kept confidential.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Amendment of adoption orders, and revocation of directions ex parte

subsection.leadIn: An application for an order under section 20(1) of the Ordinance for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amendment of an adoption order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the revocation of a direction for the marking of an entry in the registers of births or the Adopted Children Register,

subsection.continued: may be made ex parte in the Court.

subsection.leadIn: Notice of the application must be served on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other persons as the Court may think fit.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Notice of amendment to be sent to Registrar of Births and Deaths

subsection.leadIn: Where an order is made under section 20(1) of the Ordinance for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amendment of an adoption order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the revocation of a direction for the marking of an entry in the registers of births or the Adopted Children Register,

subsection.continued: the Registrar of the High Court shall send to the Registrar of Births and Deaths a notice that complies with subrule (2).

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of the adoption order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the names of the adopter and of the adopted person, as described in the schedule to the adoption order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the amendments that are to be made to the particulars specified in the order made under section 20(1) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: On the issue of an order for the amendment of an adoption order, the Court shall accordingly amend the adoption certificate issued in respect of the adoption order.

main.crossHeading: Applications under Sections 20G and 20H of the Ordinance

section.name: s28
section.heading: Application for direction where Convention adoption is not full adoption

subsection.leadIn: An application for a direction under section 20G(1) of the Ordinance in respect of a Convention adoption may be made to the Court by originating summons by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the adopted child to whom the adoption relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the adopter to whom the adoption relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a parent of the adopted child; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other person.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following persons that is not the applicant shall be a respondent to the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the adopter to whom the adoption relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each parent of the adopted child.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that if the adopted child is adopted by 2 persons jointly, “the adopter” in subrules (1)(b) and (2)(a) refers to both of the persons.

subsection.leadIn: If the adopted child is not the applicant and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the child has evidence to give to the Court that has not been given by any other party; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there are other special circumstances,

subsection.continued: the Court may at any time direct that the child be made a respondent to the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may at any time direct that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who does not fall within the description of subrule (2) be made a respondent to the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a respondent to the application be removed.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a direction is given on an application under subrule (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the adoption is a registrable adoption made outside Hong Kong (as defined in section 1(4) of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance),

subsection.continued: the Director shall notify the Registrar of Births and Deaths of the giving of the direction.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Application for non-recognition of Convention adoption on public policy ground

subsection.leadIn: An application for a declaration under section 20H(1) of the Ordinance in respect of a Convention adoption may be made to the Court by originating summons by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the adopted child to whom the adoption relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the adopter to whom the adoption relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a parent of the adopted child;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the accredited body in Hong Kong that made arrangements for the adoption (if applicable); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other person.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following persons that is not the applicant shall be a respondent to the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the adopter to whom the adoption relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each parent of the adopted child.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that if the adopted child is adopted by 2 persons jointly, “the adopter” in subrules (1)(b) and (2)(a) refers to both of the persons.

subsection.leadIn: If the adopted child is not the applicant and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the child has evidence to give to the Court that has not been given by any other party; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there are other special circumstances,

subsection.continued: the Court may at any time direct that the child be made a respondent to the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may at any time direct that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who does not fall within the description of subrule (2) be made a respondent to the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a respondent to the application be removed.

subsection.leadIn: Where a declaration is made on an application under subrule (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where the adoption is a registrable adoption made outside Hong Kong (as defined in section 1(4) of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance) the Director shall notify the Registrar of Births and Deaths of the making of the declaration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in all cases, the Director may give a copy of the declaration to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Central Authority of a Contracting State; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: either the accredited body or the public authority of a Contracting State that made arrangements for the adoption.

main.crossHeading: Delegation by Director of Social Welfare

section.name: s30
section.heading: Delegation of powers and duties
section.content: Where the Director is acting under these Rules as guardian ad litem, anything required or authorized by these Rules to be done by the guardian ad litem may be done by a public officer who is duly authorized in that behalf by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (2), a document required to be served under these Rules may be served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to the individual personally;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it with some person for the individual at the individual’s last known address or usual place of abode; or

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to him at his principal office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it to him by registered post addressed to him at his principal office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a body of persons—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to that body at that body’s registered or principal office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it to that body by registered post addressed to that body at that body’s registered or principal office.

subsection.leadIn: Where a document is to be served on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual whose last known address or usual place of abode is in a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body of persons whose registered or principal office is in a place outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: the document must be served in accordance with the law of that place.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Persons who may attest documents and declarations outside Hong Kong
section.content: For the purposes of section 7(2) of the Ordinance, a document or declaration executed or made by any person at a place outside Hong Kong is sufficiently attested if it is attested by any person for the time being authorized by law in that place to administer an oath for any judicial or other legal purpose.

main.crossHeading: Application of Practice of Court of First Instance

section.name: s33
section.heading: Practice and procedure of Court to apply
section.content: Subject to these Rules, the practice and procedure of the Court shall apply to proceedings relating to Convention adoption.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Court fees
section.content: No Court fees shall be charged in adoption proceedings that relate to Convention adoption.

This Form must be signed either by the applicants or by their solicitors.

content.inline: This statement must be verified by affidavit, to which the statement, marriage certificate and other documents referred to in the statement should be exhibited.

If the infant has not been adopted, a birth certificate should be attached. If there is no such certificate, a certified copy of the document showing that the persons named in paragraphs 5, 6 and 7 have parental rights over the infant should be attached.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Additional Matters Subject to Investigation and Report by Guardian Ad Litem

section.name: s1
section.content: In the case of a joint application, how long the applicants have been married.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: In the case of an application by one only of 2 spouses—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: whether the other spouse consents to the application; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: why he or she does not join in the application.

section.name: s3
section.content: What other children (including adopted children) the applicant has.

section.name: s4
section.content: What is the age and sex of all children living in the home of the applicant, and what is their relationship to the applicant.

section.name: s5
section.content: What number of living rooms and bedrooms are contained in the home of the applicant, and what is the condition of the home.

section.name: s6
section.content: What are the means of the applicant.

section.name: s7
section.content: Whether the applicant suffers or has suffered from any serious illness, and whether there is any history of tuberculosis, epilepsy or mental illness in his or her family.

section.name: s8
section.content: Whether any person specified in the applicant’s statement as a person to whom reference may be made is a responsible person and recommends the applicant without reservation.

section.name: s9
section.content: Whether the applicant understands that a Convention adoption order is irrevocable and that the order if made will render him or her responsible for the maintenance and upbringing of the infant.

section.name: s10
section.content: Whether the infant has any right to or interest in any property.

section.name: s11
section.content: Whether the infant (if of an age to understand the effect of a Convention adoption order) wishes the order to be made.

section.name: s12
section.content: Whether the mother consents to the adoption and identifies the birth certificate (if any) attached to the applicant’s statement as the birth certificate of the infant.

section.name: s13
section.content: Whether the father consents to the adoption.

section.name: s14
section.content: If the infant is born out of wedlock, whether an order has been made adjudging any person to be the putative father of the infant, or an agreement to contribute to the maintenance of the infant has been made by a person acknowledging himself to be the father of the infant, and in either case whether that person consents to the adoption.

section.name: s15
section.content: When did the parent or parents part with the infant, and to whom.

section.name: s16
section.content: What are the reasons of the parent or parents for consenting to the adoption, and whether his or their consent is given without pressure from other persons.

section.name: s17
section.content: Whether the parent, or each of the parents, understands that a Convention adoption order is irrevocable, and that the order if made will deprive him or her of all rights in respect of the maintenance and upbringing of the infant.

section.name: s18
section.content: Where the applicant’s statement requests the judge to dispense with the consent of the parent, or either of the parents, on the ground that he or she cannot be found, what steps have been taken to trace him or her.
